page.title: 20Future and Credits
page.content: Hartfield has a good age mixture. The large council estate mixes with the older period houses. Many people have moved into the village from London and near by towns.Houses are very expensive by south east standards. The school has risen in numbers from 70 in 1981 to an estimated 140 by 1987.Being a conservation area house building is rather limited. {Credits:}Written by Neil Hatcher,Mark Fenton,Samantha Warburton,Yvette Hill, Paul Baker,Toby Hales,Hannah Prudden, Amy Thompson,Geordie Munn,Paula Mackie,Jane Mcglew,Emma Sharp,Ruth Tiney.Also helped by Rebecca,James, Jenny,Nina,Dickon,Katrina,Joanna, Tamsin,Keri,Mark,Neil and children from Hartfield School. Mr.Wilkinson head teacher.
